column2: there are better Ramen. For example in Japan
column5: or SF. But all those places are irrelevant when you are looking for Ramen while residing in Houston. So far
column6: this is as good as it gets in Houston. Ramen wise that is. Broth is thick and sufficiently flavored
column7: Noodles have just enough bite. Pork chashu cooked through so that it falls apart in your mouth while still retaining enough texture so that you need to chew it. Other ingredients tasty as well. You can add all kinds of stuff to the base soups.
